*[[Erotic love]] – desire characterized by a focus on sexual desires.
 
*[[Erotic love]] – desire characterized by a focus on sexual desires.
 
*[[Familial love]] – affection brokered through kinship connections, intertwined with concepts of attachment and bonding.
 
*[[Familial love]] – affection brokered through kinship connections, intertwined with concepts of attachment and bonding.
−
*[[Fatherly love]] - devotion to one's children.
   
*[[Free love]] – sexual relations according to choice and unrestricted by marriage.
 
*[[Free love]] – sexual relations according to choice and unrestricted by marriage.
−
*[[Motherly love]] - devotion to one's children.
   
*[[Platonic love]] – a close relationship in which sexual desire is nonexistent or has been suppressed or sublimated.
 
*[[Platonic love]] – a close relationship in which sexual desire is nonexistent or has been suppressed or sublimated.
 
*[[Puppy love]] – romantic affection felt between or as though between adolescents.
 
*[[Puppy love]] – romantic affection felt between or as though between adolescents.
 
*[[Religious love]] – devotion to one’s deity or theology.
 
*[[Religious love]] – devotion to one’s deity or theology.
−
*[[Romantic love]] – affection characterized by a mix of emotional and sexual desire. Traditionally portrayed in the West as tragicomic, sad, joyful, and complex (e.g. I love Mabel).
+
*[[Romantic love]] – affection characterized by a mix of emotional and sexual desire.
 
*[[Unrequited love]] – affection and desire not reciprocated or returned.
 
*[[Unrequited love]] – affection and desire not reciprocated or returned.
−
*[[Covenant love]] - an unconditional decision of the will to place the needs and benefits of another person before oneself.
  −
*[[Unconditional]] Love - A voluntary practice of "knowing what someone truly is and caring for that to the exclusion of all else". Linked in some respects to philosophy of [[Non-duality]] and certain types of [[magic]]. Cited by Deepak Chopra and Marelin Thornton as a more "[[Wizard]]ly" love, as compared to all other types.
